description:
Build a 2D boss-fight action game using JavaScript and the Phaser.js framework, playable directly in a web browser.

Gameplay Overview:
- The game features one player character and one boss enemy.
- The entire fight takes place inside a single arena, similar to Hollow Knight boss rooms.
- The camera stays centered on the arena.

Player Controls:
- Move left/right: A / D or ← / → keys
- Jump: W or Spacebar
- Dodge: Shift key
  - Dodge direction depends on the movement key being held.
  - If no movement key is held, dash backward.
- Attack: J key (melee slash)
  - When attacking, show a white arc effect similar to Hollow Knight’s nail slash.
  - Include hit flash or brief particle effects when striking enemies.

Boss Behavior:
- The boss has three attack types:
  1. Melee swing (close-range attack)
  2. Jump attack (leaps toward player)
  3. Projectile attack (fires energy balls toward the player)
- Include simple telegraph animations or flashing before major attacks.
- The boss moves intelligently within the arena boundaries and reacts to player proximity.

Health System:
- Player Health:
  - Displayed in the top-left corner using Hollow Knight–style masks.
  - Each mask represents one hit point. Losing HP breaks a mask.
  - Start with 5–6 masks.
- Boss Health:
  - Displayed at the bottom center, Dark Souls–style.
  - A long red bar with the boss name above it (e.g., "Ancient Guardian").

Visual & UX:
- Use smooth sprite animations for player and boss actions.
- Attack effects should have short white slash arcs or brief impact flashes.
- Use img/player.jpg and img/boss.jpg for base character sprites.
- The arena should have a dark, atmospheric background (gray or navy gradient).
- Show visual feedback (screen shake or brief flash) on successful hits.

Technical Implementation:
- Use Phaser.js 3 or newer for rendering, physics, animation, and input.
- Organize the project into scenes:
  - PreloadScene (loads assets)
  - GameScene (main boss fight)
  - UIScene (health bars and boss name)
- Use Phaser’s Arcade Physics for collision and movement.
- Maintain a stable 60 FPS performance.
- Modularize logic into Player, Boss, AttackManager, and GameManager classes.

Goal:
Deliver a playable prototype where the player can move, jump, dodge, and attack using responsive controls to defeat a single animated boss with multiple attack patterns.
